generatedTitle: The Oldest Player in NFL History: George Blanda's Legacy

extractFactDictList.question: Who is the oldest player in NFL history?
extractFactDictList.sentence: According to the NFL's official records, the oldest player to ever play in the league was George Blanda.

extractFactDictList.question: When did George Blanda retire from the NFL?
extractFactDictList.sentence: He retired from the NFL in 1975 at the age of 48, making him the oldest player in league history.

extractFactDictList.question: How many seasons did George Blanda play in the NFL?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Blanda played in the NFL for 14 seasons, starting in 1949 with the Chicago Bears and later playing for the Baltimore Colts, Houston Oilers, and Oakland Raiders.

extractFactDictList.question: What position did George Blanda play?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Blanda was a versatile player who could play both offense and defense.

extractFactDictList.question: Was George Blanda inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame?
extractFactDictList.sentence: He was a three-time Pro Bowl selection and was inducted into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in In addition to his success in the NFL, Blanda also played in the American Football League (AFL) and was a member of the AFL's All-Time Team.
